articles.title: Supreme Court issues rare emergency order favoring voters challenging elections rules
articles.description: The Supreme Court on Friday sided with Black voters who challenged Georgia's system of electing members to the state's Public Service Commission, which regulates public utilities in the state.

articles.title: Where Are All the Manhattan Voters in August? Try the Hamptons.
articles.description: A late August congressional primary in New York has candidates scrambling to find far-flung voters who tend to summer in places like the Hamptons.

articles.author: Max Thornberry
articles.title: Michigan judge says county prosecutors cannot enforce abortion ban
articles.description: A Michigan judge overruled an early August decision, determining county prosecutors cannot enforce a 91-year-old law that bans abortions throughout the state.
articles.content:
A 91-year-old Michigan law banning abortion wont go into effect quite yet.
